Package doa.engine.scene.elements.physics

Class DoaRigidBody

java.lang.Object
doa.engine.scene.DoaComponent
doa.engine.scene.elements.physics.DoaRigidBody
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class DoaRigidBody extends DoaComponent
A body of simulated physics.
Since:
DoaEngine 3.0
Version:
3.0
Author:
Doga Oruc

  • Field Details

    • linearVelocity

      @NotNull public @NotNull DoaVector linearVelocity
      Starting linear velocity of the body. Default value is (0, 0).

    • angularVelocity

      public float angularVelocity
      Starting angular velocity of the body. Default value is 0.

    • linearDampening

      public float linearDampening
      Linear dampening of the body. Default value is 0.

    • angularDampening

      public float angularDampening
      Angular dampening of the body. Default value is 0.01.

    • mass

      public float mass
      Mass of the body. Default value is 1.

    • friction

      public float friction
      Friction coefficient of the body. Default value is 0.2.

    • elasticity

      public float elasticity
      Bounciness of the body. Default value is 0. Recommended value is 0.6 for bouncy objects.

    • type

      @NotNull public @NotNull DoaBodyType type
      One of the three body types. See DoaBodyType

    • colliders

      @NotNull public final @NotNull List<DoaCollider> colliders
      Shape of the body.

    • fixedRotation

      public boolean fixedRotation
      When true, the body will not rotate.

    • isBullet

      public boolean isBullet
      When true, the physics engine will treat this object as a bullet and apply continuous collision check to it. Prevents ghosting at the cost of performance.

    • canSleep

      public boolean canSleep
      Set this flag to false if this body should never fall asleep. Note that costs performance. Sleeping bodies have little CPU overhead.

    • DoaRigidBody

      public DoaRigidBody()

  • Method Details

    • setLinearVelocity

      public void setLinearVelocity​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaVector v)
      Set the linear velocity of the center of mass.
      Parameters:
      v - the new linear velocity of the center of mass.

    • getLinearVelocity

      public DoaVector getLinearVelocity()
      Returns copy the linear velocity of the center of mass.
      Returns:
      copy of the linear velocity of the center of mass.

    • setAngularVelocity

      public void setAngularVelocity​(float w)
      Set the angular velocity.
      Parameters:
      w - the new angular velocity in degrees/second.

    • getAngularVelocity

      public float getAngularVelocity()
      Returns the angular velocity.
      Returns:
      the angular velocity in degress/second.

    • setTransform

      public void setTransform​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaTransform transform)
      Set the transform. Calling this method is ill-advised, all physics motion should be left to the physics engine. This method is here for compatibility reasons.
      Parameters:
      transform - transform to override with

    • getTransform

      public DoaTransform getTransform()
      Returns the transform.
      Returns:
      transform

    • applyForce

      public void applyForce​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaVector force, @NotNull @NotNull DoaVector point)
      Apply a force at a world point. If the force is not applied at the center of mass, it will generate a torque and affect the angular velocity. This wakes up the body.
      Parameters:
      force - the world force vector, usually in Newtons (N).
      point - the world position of the point of application.

    • applyForceToCenter

      public void applyForceToCenter​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaVector force)
      Apply a force to the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
      Parameters:
      force - the world force vector, usually in Newtons (N).

    • applyTorque

      public void applyTorque​(float torque)
      Apply a torque. This affects the angular velocity without affecting the linear velocity of the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
      Parameters:
      torque - about the z-axis (out of the screen), usually in N-m.

    • applyLinearImpulse

      public void applyLinearImpulse​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaVector impulse, @NotNull @NotNull DoaVector point)
      Apply an impulse at a point. This immediately modifies the velocity. It also modifies the angular velocity if the point of application is not at the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
      Parameters:
      impulse - the world impulse vector, usually in N-seconds or kg-m/s.
      point - the world position of the point of application.

    • applyAngularImpulse

      public void applyAngularImpulse​(float impulse)
      Apply an angular impulse.
      Parameters:
      impulse - the angular impulse in units of kg*m*m/s

    • tick

      public void tick()

    • getNativeBody

      @Internal public org.jbox2d.dynamics.Body getNativeBody()
      Normally, programmers shouldn't need to call this method. This method is on the grey when it comes to the Internal annotation. Call, if you know what you are doing.
      Returns:
      the handle to the native-Box2D Body
